Package Algorithms

Class MultiCSV

  • java.lang.Object
    • Algorithms.MultiCSV

  • public final class MultiCSV
extends java.lang.Object
    a class that can read Multiple CSV files from a directory and its sub-directories and convert them into a GIS_Project obj. Note: using a relative path

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void createKML​(GIS_layer layer, java.lang.String fileName)
      Exporting GIS_layer type object to a single KML file that can be read by Google Earth.
      static void createKML​(GIS_project project, java.lang.String fileName)
      Exporting GIS_project type object to a single KML file that can be read by Google Earth.
      static GIS_project readDirectory​(java.lang.String folder)
      read all CSV files in given folder and its subdirectories and converts them into GIS_project object instance.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • readDirectory

        public static GIS_project readDirectory​(java.lang.String folder)
        read all CSV files in given folder and its subdirectories and converts them into GIS_project object instance.
        using the "CsvReader" static class to read single CSV files, this function uses recursion of CsvReader to read directories and folders.
        [Note: using a relative path!]
        Parameters:
        folder - - to read CSV files from
        Returns:
        GIS_project object which is a set contains GIS_layers, each GIS_layer is equivalent to a single CSV file.

      • createKML

        public static void createKML​(GIS_project project,
                             java.lang.String fileName)
        Exporting GIS_project type object to a single KML file that can be read by Google Earth.
        Parameters:
        project - the GIS_project object to get the data from.
        fileName - relative path to save the KML file: EX: "Src/Data/myKML.kml"

      • createKML

        public static void createKML​(GIS_layer layer,
                             java.lang.String fileName)
        Exporting GIS_layer type object to a single KML file that can be read by Google Earth.
        Parameters:
        layer - the GIS_layer object to get the data from.
        fileName - relative path to save the KML file: EX: "Src/Data/myKML.kml"
